intro: Assonia cymosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Assonia cymosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
